metadata.title: CVE-2017-7875 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In wallpaper.c in feh before v2.18.3, if a malicious client pretends to bethe E17 window manager, it is possible to trigger an out-of-boundary heapwrite while receiving an IPC message. An integer overflow leads to a bufferoverflow and/or a double free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7875` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

feh - 2.23.2-1build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: feh package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.23.2-1build1').
